fields.summary: iOS: Support Insert style rows in TableViews

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A week ago I did a pull request to add UITableViewCellEditingStyleInsert iOS API as styleInsert

You can find the blog write up here: http://blog.codexlabs.com/blog/2013/08/31/uitableviewcelleditingstyleinsert-is-now-a-pull-request-for-titanium-mobile/

This is a change that I have held onto for over a year and feel that it should ultimately be contributed back into Tableviews and now listviews. 


I would like to start the discussion on what the actual API to call  UITableViewCellEditingStyleInsert should be in titanium.

Also, I need to sign the CLA (I can't believe I haven't signed it already)

It would be great to see this API finally supported in Titanium.
fields.summary: added UITableViewCellEditingStyleInsert iOS API as styleInsert

comments.body:
pull request can be found here: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/4636
I don't think that the way I implemented the API is ideal, but this is a useful attribute.

Hello,

Did you already sign the CLA? https://appcelerator.echosign.com/public/hostedForm?formid=3KEUBX34W4UH

This is not a bug. If you already send the pull request, the platform team will decide if is possible to add it right now. 

Thanks for your interest into this! 

Best,

Mauro

I just signed the CLA to be sure. 
I probably signed a CLA implicitly before being a Titanium Certified Instructor, but I went ahead and resigned it just now. I'm perfectly fine with the CLA since it has an exemption clause if I need it. However, this pull request IS a contribution
Closing this feature request and pull request to existing ticket TIMOB-7735. Please follow along that ticket for further updates.
